title.narrative: OP3: PRIMARY EDUCATION

description.narrative: District educational structures in four educationally disadvantaged provinces have the technical capacity to deliver primary education services which meet national quality standards by December 2016

sector.narrative: Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision of parental education for school readiness (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: District educational structures in four educationally disadvantaged provinces have the technical capacity to deliver primary education services which meet national quality standards by December 2016

description.narrative: Quality improvement was enhanced through evidence-based quality reform, supported by situation analyses on primary student learning outcomes and the assessment system, and sub-national and school level capacity building. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/01/2017

title.narrative: Primary education textbooks purchased with funding managed by UNICEF and distributed

actual.value: 2016:2,370,000 All grade 3, 4 and 5 students (230,156 girls) received a set of textbooks in 2016 in accordance to the national standard of one textbook per student per subject.

title.narrative: Availability of an effective pedagogical advisory system providing support to primary school teachers in 4 Districts

baseline.value: 0/3 points (1 point: Revised PA TOR, 1 point: each primary school receiving 3 PA visits/year, 1 point: increased knowledge of PA

target.value: 2016:3/3 points (1 point: Revised PA TOR, 1 point: each primary school receiving 3 PA visits/year, 1 point: increased knowledge of PA

actual.value: 2016:1/3 Review of TOR undertaken as part of the analysis of pedagogical support system, by the revised PA TOR is yet under development, 2. Each school in the 4 target districts received at last two PA visits/year, 3. Pedagogical Advisors increased knowledge and skills on learning outcomes-oriented teac

title.narrative: Districts implement a monitoring framework for National Quality Primary School Standards

actual.value: 2016:Implemented (The tools for measuring school progress against the national Primary Education Quality Standards implemented in 4 UNICEF supported districts. Lessons learned from this practice being used for further improvement of the tools and guideline for the national use).
